content: In the fourth quarter of 2022, we plan to submit what we believe will be the most comprehensive regulatory package ever for a dry eye disease drug candidate with results based on five adequate and well-controlled completed clinical trials, we intend to submit the NDA with data for ocular dryness symptom score, ocular redness, Schirmer test, and Schirmer test â¥10 mm responder analysis. Based on our current operating plan, we believe that existing cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities will be sufficient to fund currently projected operating expenses through the end of 2023, including NDA submissions and initial commercialization of both reproxalap and ADX-2191 if approved, and continued early and late stage development of Aldeyra's product candidates in ocular and systemic immune mediated diseases. With two late stage candidates in anterior ocular and rare retinal diseases representing potential revenue streams in 2023, and our clinical stage RASP modulator platform and systemic immune mediated diseases, Aldeyra's pipeline represents an innovative opportunity to positively affect patient care in both large and rare diseases.
